MS MCQs

    Identify project lifecycle management capabilities in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Project Operations

    »

    1. Rodney, a project manager at Contoso, is new to Project Operations. He needs to make the information in a project quotation become binding. What should he do?

      Copy the information in the quotation in a project associated with a project contract.

      Enter the estimated surcharges for the project in the quotation.

      Just create the project quotation, information in it is binding from the start.


    2. Rodney is creating a WBS for the new project. He has just completed creating the tasks. What should he do next?

      He should create a work schedule next to estimate the time required to complete a task, set task interdependencies, and select the start and end dates for tasks.

      He should breakdown the tasks into more manageable chunks.

      He should do a cost estimation next to estimate associated costs for each task.


    3. Which project type allows billing the customer for costs that include hours, expenses, items, and fees?

      Fixed price project

      Time and material project

      Cost project
